title: Solskjaer privately fears he will lose his job if Man Utd finish outside top-six
text:
Solskjaer fears he may lose his job (Picture: AMA/Getty Images)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer privately fears he will get the boot if Manchester United fail to deliver a top-six Premier League finish this season, despite the club insisting they will give him time to rebuild.

The Norwegian has come under fire after a miserable start to the season, with United two points above the relegation zone having picked up only eight points from their opening eight matches.

League leaders Liverpool are already 15 points ahead of Solskjaer’s struggling side and there is little evidence to suggest dramatic improvements are around the corner.

While Solskjaer has been assured he has time to turn things around, he feels he will be sacked if he can’t guide United into the top-six and he feels he needs to win a trophy in his second full season in charge in order to survive at Old Trafford in the long run, according to the Daily Mail.

A patient approach is being adopted by the club’s hierarchy, who accept there is no quick fix to their current plight, but still Solskjaer remains concerned over his future.
